item.title: I Will Provide for My Saints
item.description: Through Jesus Christ, the blessings of self-reliance are available to all.

item.title: Choosing a Self-Reliance Group
item.description: In this dramatized video, learn more about the different self-reliance groups and which group might best fit your situation.

item.title: Go and Do Learning
item.description: This video describes the “Go and Do” learning process, which extends beyond simply learning to pondering, committing, acting, and reporting. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How to Facilitate a Group
item.description: This video describes how to facilitate a self-reliance group and also describes the differences between a traditional teacher and a self-reliance facilitator. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How to: Prepare
item.description: This video describes how a facilitator prepares himself or herself spiritually, prepares the facilities and materials, and reminds the group members to attend. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How to Lead: My Foundation
item.description: This video describes how a facilitator involves group members in leading the weekly My Foundation discussion. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How to Lead: Report
item.description: This video describes how a facilitator conducts the Return and Report portion of the meeting and how to motivate people to keep commitments and improve performance. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How to Lead: Learn
item.description: This video describes how a facilitator conducts the Learn section of a group meeting, including “read,” “watch,” “discuss,” and “practice” subsections. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How to Lead: Ponder
item.description: This video describes how a facilitator conducts the Ponder section of a group meeting, including getting group members to record impressions of how the things they have learned can be applicable in their lives. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How to Lead: Commit
item.description: This video describes how a facilitator conducts the Commit section of a group meeting, including helping members understand and make commitments and be accountable to an action partner. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How to: Manage Meetings
item.description: This video describes how a facilitator manages a group meeting and encourages participation from each group member. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: My Purpose
item.description: This video describes the role and duties of a self-reliance group facilitator. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Stake Self-Reliance Specialists
item.description: A depiction of the calling, training, and monitoring of stake self-reliance specialists. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Action Partners: Sam and Dave
item.description: Working with an action partner can help us become more self-reliant. This dramatized video shows action partners how they might help and support one another.

item.title: Action Partners: Gabby and Beth
item.description: Working with an action partner can help us become more self-reliant. This dramatized video shows action partners how they might help and support one another.

item.title: Laboring Unto Self-Reliance
item.description: Using self-reliance resources to bless the lives of members.

item.title: How to Use My Path
item.description: This video shows how a My Path pamphlet may be used to identify those who are not self-reliant and help them choose one of three paths: job search, self-employment, and education. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: I Will Provide for My Saints
item.description: Through Jesus Christ, the blessings of self-reliance are available to all.

item.title: The Stake Self-Reliance Committee
item.description: This video describes the roles and duties of the stake self-reliance committee and each of its members. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: The Stake Self-Reliance Committee Meeting
item.description: A depiction of a stake self-reliance committee meeting, how it is led, and participation by various council members. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Stake Self-Reliance Specialists
item.description: A depiction of the calling, training, and monitoring of stake self-reliance specialists. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Helping Ward Councils
item.description: This video depicts stake leaders training ward council members in self-reliance. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How to Form Self-Reliance Groups
item.description: This video depicts a “My Path night” to introduce members to the program and shows how members select the course they will pursue. The video also includes individual members’ reactions to the program. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Choosing a Self-Reliance Group
item.description: In this dramatized video, learn more about the different self-reliance groups and which group might best fit your situation.

item.description: Through Jesus Christ, the blessings of self-reliance are available to all.

item.description: In this dramatized video, see how someone can benefit from the unique setting of a self-reliance group.

item.description: In this dramatized video, learn more about the different self-reliance groups and which group might best fit your situation.

category.title: Self-Reliance is a Principle of Salvation
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: He Polished My Toe
item.description: As a boy, Elder Enrique R. Falabella learned there is a solution to every problem. By living self-reliance principles and not being complacent, all of us can become better. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

category.title: Principle 1: Exercise Faith in Jesus Christ
category.subtitle: Videos: 2

item.title: Exercise Faith in Christ
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar teaches that taking action is the exercise of faith. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Pure and Simple Faith
item.description: A young woman exhibits faith that God will provide a way to meet her family’s basic needs. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: The Gift of Time
item.description: A woman schedules her day in order to accomplish what is most important. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Obedience Brings Blessings
item.description: President Monson talks on blessings of obedience. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: First Things First!
item.description: Two children dress up as adults and pretend to be a young married couple discussing finances. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Sedrick’s Journey
item.description: A young man earns money for his mission by hauling bananas on his bike. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: A Bigger Truck?
item.description: Elder Oaks tells a story of two watermelon salesmen who buy and sell their product at the same price. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Solve Problems and Make Decisions
item.description: Two animated farm animals discuss problem solving and decision making. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: In the Lord's Way
item.description: Presidents Eyring and Uchtdorf discuss basic welfare principles and serving one another. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Creating Lift
item.description: President Uchtdorf discusses how prayer can help us achieve spiritual lift. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Only a Stonecutter
item.description: Elder Holland tells the story of John R. Moyle, a stonemason who worked on the Salt Lake Temple despite the loss of his leg. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Pure and Simple Faith
item.description: A young woman exhibits faith that God will provide a way to meet her family’s basic needs. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: What Shall a Man Give in Exchange for His Soul?
item.description: Elder Gay talks about integrity and the lesson he learned from his father after being dishonest about his age in order to get extra candy bars at the movies. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: The Glory of God Is Intelligence
item.description: A man talks about the importance of education, study, and learning while faithfully enduring to the end. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Education for a Better Life
item.description: Elder Joseph W. Sitati discusses how he overcame hurdles to get a good education in Kenya. Pursuing an education allowed him to find his wife, a secure job and the gospel of Jesus Christ. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

category.title: Principle 12: Stay on Task, Receive Ordinances
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: Doing What Matters Most
item.description: President Uchtdorf talks about a plane that crashed within 20 miles of the airport because the crew failed to notice a single burned-out lightbulb. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Of Regrets and Resolutions
item.description: Quote given by President Dieter F. Uchtdorf in the Saturday morning session on October 6, 2012.

category.title: Chapter 1: How do I start or improve my business?
category.subtitle: Videos: 3

item.title: Samuel: Computer Repair
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses the importance of keeping separate business and personal financial records. He also talks about how closely related temporal and spiritual principles are. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Action and Commitment
item.description: This video discusses the course’s method of learning, in which we commit to act upon the principles taught. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: My Self-Reliance Group
item.description: A self-reliance group is different from a traditional classroom setting. This dramatized video shows group members how to get the most out of their group experience.

category.title: Chapter 2: What do people want to buy?
category.subtitle: Videos: 5

item.title: Joseph and John: Medical Products
item.description: Two self-employment group members discuss how they became business partners through the self-reliance group and how they combined one partner’s idea with the other partner’s resources. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Talking to Customers
item.description: A group member interviews a customer about why he is a patron of a specific business. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Talking to Business Owners
item.description: A group member interviews a produce stand owner about how her business operates. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Selecting the Right Business
item.description: This video discusses critical elements of a successful business: customers and products, our skills and interests, competition and the environment, and income potential. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Business on a Stick
item.description: This animated depiction of an interview of three business owners emphasizes the importance of satisfying customer needs. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

category.title: Chapter 3: How do I buy my product and set the sales price?
category.subtitle: Videos: 4

item.title: Talking to Suppliers
item.description: A group member interviews a produce supplier about how his business operates. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Don’t Close Your Business: Part I
item.description: A business owner experiences higher costs and diminishing profits in her water business. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Don’t Close Your Business: Part II
item.description: A business owner experiences higher costs and diminishing profits in her water business. Two friends talk to her about how to negotiate with suppliers. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: A Bigger Truck?
item.description: Elder Oaks tells a story of two watermelon salesmen who buy and sell their product at the same price. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

category.title: Chapter 4: How do I know if my business is making a profit?
category.subtitle: Videos: 2

item.title: I Don’t Know
item.description: A carpenter learns the importance of keeping financial records. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Vangelis: Street Magician
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses the importance of record keeping and separating personal and business expenditures. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

category.title: Chapter 5: How do I separate my business and family money?
category.subtitle: Videos: 5

item.title: Daniel and Christiana: General Store
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses how the program taught him marketing and better customer relations. He also discusses the role of prayer and faith in his business. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Your Water Business
item.description: This video gives instruction on how to keep separate business and personal records, with examples of business and personal income and expense items and how to record them. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Don’t Kill the Chickens: Part I
item.description: A business owner explains to her relative why she cannot sell her business assets to help pay for his new apartment. Part I shows the relative requesting money from the business owner. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Don’t Kill the Chickens: Part II
item.description: A business owner explains to her relative why she cannot sell her business assets to help pay for his new apartment. Part II explains the importance of separating business and personal assets. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Don’t Kill the Chickens: Part III
item.description: A business owner explains to her relative why she cannot sell her business assets to help pay for his new apartment. Part III shows the business owner explaining to the relative why she cannot grant his full request. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

category.title: Chapter 6: How is my business progressing?
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: Felix: Refrigeration Parts
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses how the program taught him not only better business practices but how to involve his family and improve his personal life. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

category.title: Chapter 7: How will I grow my business?
category.subtitle: Videos: 3

item.title: Susy: Private School Bus
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses the investment and sacrifice it took to start his business and how it allowed him to no longer have to work on the Sabbath. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Careful with Fixed Costs
item.description: A business owner learns how to recognize the difference between fixed and variable costs to help her in the decision to buy more productive assets. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Bicycle or Chickens?
item.description: A business owner learns how productive assets can help her business make more money, and she discusses with a friend whether she should buy a bicycle or more chickens. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

category.title: Chapter 8: How much can I afford to invest to grow my business?
category.subtitle: Videos: 4

item.title: Rosanny: Hot Food
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses how the program taught her to use debt appropriately and how being successful in her business has raised her self-esteem. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How Much Cash Is Available?
item.description: This video describes how to create a simple cash flow statement to determine if a business owner can afford more assets. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Can I Afford More Assets: Part 1
item.description: A business owner discusses with a friend the importance of understanding the business cash flow in order to determine if she can afford new assets. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Can I Afford More Assets: Part 2
item.description: A business owner expresses gratitude to her friend for helping her understand her business cash flow and avoid excessive loan payments. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

category.title: Chapter 9: How do I know if I should use a loan to grow my business?
category.subtitle: Videos: 5

item.title: Get a Loan?
item.description: Business owners discuss their plans to get a loan for business and consumer purposes. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Right Amount?
item.description: Business owners discuss the effects of borrowing too much and the need to calculate the appropriate amount based upon business cash flow statements. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Right Terms?
item.description: A business owner gets his loan without understanding the basic contract terms. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Right Time?
item.description: Business owners discuss when is the appropriate time to borrow, as well as the need to have been in business long enough to be able to forecast cash flow. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Right Reason?
item.description: Business owners discuss the differences between business and personal loans and borrowing for the right reason. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

category.title: Chapter 10: How will I attract more customers and close sales?
category.subtitle: Videos: 5

item.title: Ask, Listen, Suggest
item.description: A business owner asks appropriate questions, listens to her customer, and then suggests solutions to meet her customer’s needs. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Please Buy Something!
item.description: A business owner exhibits overly aggressive sales tactics and loses customers. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Marketing?
item.description: A business owner and friend discuss the benefit of marketing to increase business sales. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Sell, Sell, Sell: Part I
item.description: Part I: An animated depiction of a business owner selling chocolate-covered bananas on a stick. This video addresses the need for market research and satisfying customers’ needs. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Sell, Sell, Sell: Part II
item.description: Part II: An animated depiction of a business owner selling chocolate-covered bananas on a stick. This video addresses the need for market research and satisfying customers’ needs. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

category.title: Chapter 11: How will I increase my profits?
category.subtitle: Videos: 3

item.title: Turn Inventory Quickly
item.description: Two business owners discuss the need to sell inventory quickly and minimize excess inventory. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: The Upsell
item.description: A business owner recognizes a customer’s need and takes the opportunity to sell a service in addition to the basic product sale. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Made the Sale, Missed the Sale!
item.description: A business owner makes a sale but fails to recognize the customer’s full needs and her own opportunity to make a larger sale. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

category.title: Chapter 12: How do I continue to improve my business?
category.subtitle: Videos: 2

item.title: My Business in Five Minutes
item.description: One member presents to the group a summary of her business in five minutes. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: We Can Do This!
item.description: A business owner and her husband discuss what they have learned in the Starting and Growing Your Business course and express their belief that they can succeed in their business. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: My Self-Reliance Group

item.description: This video discusses this course's method of learning, in which we work to keep commitments and to support each other as action partners.

item.title: Why Do People Buy?
item.description: This animated video emphasizes the importance of satisfying customer needs.

item.title: Unmet Needs
item.description: A man named Mark is thinking about starting a business. He meets with his friend to identify unmet customer needs.

item.title: Competitive Advantage
item.description: A man named Mark talks with his friend and learns about competitive advantages that he might have in starting his business.

category.title: Chapter 3: Ensuring That I Have a Profitable Business
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: Would I Want This Business?
item.description: A student named Sage interviews a couple who owns a mobile oil change business. Sage is trying to determine if the couple has a profitable business.

item.title: Adjusting to Market Change
item.description: A woman named Gabbie is struggling with her tutoring business. She talks with her friend about how to keep her business competitive.

category.title: Chapter 7: Keeping Separate My Business and Personal Money
category.subtitle: Videos: 3

item.title: Opportunity of a Lifetime? Part 1
item.description: A business owner named Mark explains to his sister why he cannot take money from his business to give her a loan. Part 1 shows Mark’s sister asking him for a loan.

item.title: Opportunity of a Lifetime? Part 2
item.description: A business owner named Mark explains to his sister why he cannot take money from his business to give her a loan. Part 2 explains the importance of separating business and personal money.

item.title: Opportunity of a Lifetime? Part 3
item.description: A business owner named Mark explains to his sister why he cannot take money from his business to give her a loan. Part 3 shows Mark explaining to his sister why he cannot grant her full request.

item.title: It Was a Miracle
item.description: In this dramatization of a true story, learn how faith, hard work, and learning to job search can help you get a great job and provide for your family.

item.title: My Self-Reliance Group
item.description: A self-reliance group is different from a traditional classroom setting. This dramatized video shows group members how to get the most out of their group experience.

item.title: How Jobs are Really Filled
item.description: In this dramatization of true events, an employer shares how job seekers should really be spending their time; networking.

item.title: Basketball Got Me a Job
item.description: In this dramatized true story, see how networking with friends using a “Me in 30 Seconds” statement can help you find a job in the hidden job market.

category.title: Chapter 3: Match Your Skills to the Employer’s Needs
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: The 16th Time is the Charm
item.description: Learn about the importance of identifying employer needs and adapting your applications accordingly. Based on true events.

item.title: The Power of Power Statements
item.description: Power statements are the best way to talk about your experience and accomplishments. This dramatized true story shows how power statements worked for this job seeker.

item.title: Better Written Materials
item.description: Learn how improving your résumé and other written materials can make a big difference. Based on a true story.

item.title: The Interview
item.description: Three job candidates show what not to do in an interview. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Amy Nails Her Interview
item.description: In this dramatized true story, a job seeker shares how faith and preparation helped her have a successful interview.

item.title: Practice Interview Activity
item.description: A Find a Better Job group demonstrates how to do the practice interview activity.

item.title: Practice Makes Perfect
item.description: Practicing will help you have successful interviews. Based on true events, this video shares how practice led to success for this job seeker.

item.title: Josh Works Smart
item.description: This video demonstrates that working hard should be combined with working smart as a job seeker. Focus on resources and contacts every day.

item.title: Rafael: Job in Six Days!
item.description: A job search group member discusses his successful six-day job search following a period of seven months of unemployment. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Keep it Simple
item.description: In this dramatization of true events, an employer shares her perspective on what employees can do to be successful at work.

item.title: Growing
item.description: The skills it took to find your job are the same skills you will need to progress in your job. Based on true events.

item.title: Spiritually Prepared
item.description: Sister Julie Beck, Relief Society general president, talks on being spiritually prepared to qualify for, receive, and act on personal revelation. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

category.title: Chapter 8: Create an Environment for Success
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: Good Things to Come
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland recalls his days as a poor young father with a broken-down family car and testifies that for those who embrace the gospel of Jesus Christ, there are better days and good things to come.

category.title: Chapter 1: Becoming a Wise and Faithful Steward
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: My Self-Reliance Group
item.description: A self-reliance group is different from a traditional classroom setting. This dramatized video shows group members how to get the most out of their group experience.

category.title: Chapter 2: Becoming Unified in Our Approach to Finances
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: Family Councils
item.description: Elder M. Russell Ballard shares instruction and promises about family councils.

item.title: Widow of Zarephath
item.description: The Lord rewards faith as we strive for self-reliance.

item.title: Continue in Patience
item.description: Patience requires that we obey God's commandments and faithfully wait for His will to be fulfilled.

item.title: Digital Systems
item.description: The benefits of using apps, computers, and other digital systems to create and manage a budget.

item.title: The Envelope System
item.description: A simple and popular method for budgeting is presented.

item.title: Geraldine: He Cares
item.description: Self-reliance principles lead to better jobs for more than one member of this family.

item.title: He Opens Doors
item.description: A couple describes how following the principles of self-reliance impacted their entire family.

item.title: Morales: Meeting Our Potential
item.description: Self-reliance principles sustain a couple through an unexpected employment loss.

item.title: Ronwen: Simple Principles
item.description: We can all improve our self-reliance, even if we don't realize it at first.

item.title: Stephanie: You Can Do It
item.description: After struggling all her life, Stephanie is feeling the help of her Heavenly Father as she improves her education.

item.title: Castanedas: Financial Planning for Our Future
item.description: A couple describes how a self-reliance group helped them begin preparing for the future.

item.title: Tamisha: Finding a Better Job
item.description: A woman shares how her self-reliance group helped her find purpose and faith during a job search and career transition.

item.title: Curtis and Pshaunda: Making Finances Personal
item.description: A couple shares how the Personal Finances self-reliance group helped them gain financial skills and a witness that the temporal and the spiritual are one.

item.title: Merrills: Growing My Business
item.description: A couple shares how the Starting and Growing My Business self-reliance group led to greater faith and a stronger business.

item.title: Deborah: Faith and Finances
item.description: A Personal Finances participant shares how her group experience taught her the spiritual and temporal are related, and how faith mattered in her finances.

item.title: Jackson: Learning for a Lifetime
item.description: A returned missionary shares how the Education for Better Work self-reliance group helped him find direction for life after his mission.

item.title: Hector: Improving More Than Just My Business
item.description: Hector gets the support and knowledge he needs to improve and develop his business by trusting in the Lord and attending a self-reliance group.

item.title: The Challenge to Become
item.description: The Challenge to Become

item.title: He Polished My Toe
item.description: As a boy, Elder Enrique R. Falabella learned there is a solution to every problem. By living self-reliance principles and not being complacent, all of us can become better. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Education for a Better Life
item.description: Elder Joseph W. Sitati discusses how he overcame hurdles to get a good education in Kenya. Pursuing an education allowed him to find his wife, a secure job and the gospel of Jesus Christ. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Rosanny: Hot Food
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses how the program taught her to use debt appropriately and how being successful in her business has raised her self-esteem. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Rafael: Job in Six Days!
item.description: A job search group member discusses his successful six-day job search following a period of seven months of unemployment. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Samuel: Computer Repair
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses the importance of keeping separate business and personal financial records. He also talks about how closely related temporal and spiritual principles are. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Stanley: Masonry and Construction
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses the importance of marketing and how the course has helped him focus on his customers’ needs. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Vangelis: Street Magician
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses the importance of record keeping and separating personal and business expenditures. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Susy: Private School Bus
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses the investment and sacrifice it took to start his business and how it allowed him to no longer have to work on the Sabbath. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Joseph: Fast Food
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses how the self-reliance group helped him to decide to expand his fast food business. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Joseph and John: Medical Products
item.description: Two self-employment group members discuss how they became business partners through the self-reliance group and how they combined one partner’s idea with the other partner’s resources. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Daniel and Christiana: General Store
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses how the program taught him marketing and better customer relations. He also discusses the role of prayer and faith in his business. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Bishop Diaz
item.description: A bishop discusses the economic challenges his members face and how the self-reliance program has helped them. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Dorothy: Groundnut Paste
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses how the program taught her to expand her product offering to better meet the needs of the customer. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Felix: Refrigeration Parts
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses how the program taught him not only better business practices but how to involve his family and improve his personal life. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Irene: Mobile Sewing Service
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses how the program taught her to better utilize her business assets (a sewing machine). Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Antar: Exercise and Fitness
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses his successful business and how the course has helped him improve his business. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE
